Class SokobanModel

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.framework.core.AbstractGameModel
com.aoopproject.games.sokoban.model.SokobanModel
public class SokobanModel extends AbstractGameModel
Implements the game logic for the Sokoban puzzle game. This class manages the game board (a grid of SokobanTiles), the player's position, box movements, the undo history specific to Sokoban, and checks for win conditions (all boxes on target locations).

It extends AbstractGameModel, relying on the superclass to handle common framework actions and to manage observers, game status, score (interpreted as move count), and the basic undo history stack mechanism. This class implements game-specific logic within processGameSpecificAction(GameAction), initializeGame(), undoLastMove(), canUndo(), isValidAction(GameAction), and checkEndGameConditions().

  • Constructor Details

    • SokobanModel

      public SokobanModel(DifficultyLevel difficulty)
      Constructs a SokobanModel with the specified difficulty level. The actual level data (String array) will be chosen based on this difficulty within the initializeGame() method if no specific level data is pre-set.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The selected DifficultyLevel. Must not be null.

    • SokobanModel

      public SokobanModel()
      Default constructor, initializes with DifficultyLevel.MEDIUM.

    • SokobanModel

      public SokobanModel(String[] levelData, DifficultyLevel difficulty)
      Constructs a SokobanModel with the given level data string array and associates it with a specific difficulty. This constructor is useful for tests or loading specific levels directly.
      Parameters:
      levelData - A String array representing the level layout. If null or empty, a default for the specified difficulty will be used by initializeGame.
      difficulty - The DifficultyLevel to associate with this game instance. Must not be null.

  • Method Details

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame()
      Initializes or resets the game to the starting state of a level. If this.currentLevelData was pre-set by a constructor, that level is used. Otherwise, a level is chosen based on this.currentDifficulty. Parses the level data, creates the game board, sets player position, counts targets, resets score, sets status to PLAYING, clears undo history, and notifies observers.
      Specified by:
      initializeGame in class AbstractGameModel

    • processGameSpecificAction

      protected void processGameSpecificAction(GameAction action)
      Processes Sokoban-specific game actions, primarily player movement and box pushing. This method is called by AbstractGameModel.processInputAction(GameAction) when the game is PLAYING and the action is not a common framework one.
      Specified by:
      processGameSpecificAction in class AbstractGameModel
      Parameters:
      action - The SokobanMoveAction to process.

    • undoLastMove

      public void undoLastMove()
      Undoes the last successful move by restoring the game state from history.
      Specified by:
      undoLastMove in class AbstractGameModel

    • canUndo

      public boolean canUndo()
      Checks if an undo operation is possible.
      Specified by:
      canUndo in class AbstractGameModel
      Returns:
      true if undo history is not empty.

    • isValidAction

      public boolean isValidAction(GameAction action)
      Validates if a given GameAction is permissible in the current Sokoban game state. Primarily checks SokobanMoveAction for validity based on game rules. Other common actions (NewGame, Undo, Quit) are assumed to be handled by AbstractGameModel for their basic enablement, though this method also returns true for them.
      Specified by:
      isValidAction in class AbstractGameModel
      Parameters:
      action - The game action to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the action is considered valid, false otherwise.

    • checkEndGameConditions

      protected void checkEndGameConditions()
      Checks if all targets are covered by boxes to determine win condition. If all targets are covered and game is PLAYING, status is set to GAME_OVER_WIN.
      Specified by:
      checkEndGameConditions in class AbstractGameModel

    • getPlayerRow

      public int getPlayerRow()
      Returns:
      The player's current row.

    • getPlayerCol

      public int getPlayerCol()
      Returns:
      The player's current column.

    • getTotalTargets

      public int getTotalTargets()
      Returns:
      The total number of targets in the current level.

    • getBoxesOnTargets

      public int getBoxesOnTargets()
      Returns:
      The current number of boxes on target locations.
